conclusion: Analyze the motion of the charged particle in the electric field.
Particle enters the field with initial velocity perpendicular to the electric field and exits with speed v0 at angle θ = 60° to horizontal.
Horizontal component of velocity after exiting the field is v_x = v_0 cos(60°) = 1/2 v_0.
Vertical component of velocity after exiting the field is v_y = v_0 sin(60°) = √3/2 v_0.
Vertical motion is under influence of electric field, not gravity.
Horizontal distance traveled is d = v_x * t = R cos(60°) = 1/2 R.
Time of flight t = R / (2 v_0).
Vertical distance traveled is y = v_y * t = √3/4 R.
Acceleration in vertical direction is a = F/m = qE/m.
Vertical component of velocity v_y = a * t.
Equation √3/2 v_0 = (qE/m) * (R/(2 v_0)) leads to E = (m v_0 √3)/(q R).
Magnitude of electric field strength is (m v_0 √3)/(q R).
